title: How to Play "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" on the Keyboard Without Reading Sheet Music

steps.title: Find Middle C on your keyboard.
steps.content: Find Middle C on your keyboard. "C" is always the white key to the immediate left of the 2 black keys, and Middle C is the C closest to the center of your keyboard. Put your thumb above the C key. Use this picture to help you find the notes.

steps.title: Find the G key.
steps.content: Find the G key. Count four white keys to the right of Middle C. This is "G."Put your ring finger above the G key.

steps.title: Find the A key.
steps.content: Find the A key. Locate the white key to the right of G. This key is called "A." Put your little finger above A key.

steps.title: Play the keys in the following pattern:
steps.content: Play the keys in the following pattern: "CC GG AA G." Play the keys in the rhythm that matches "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star." If you find it helpful, sing at the same time that you press the keys to have a better idea of the rhythm.

steps.title: Note the three keys between Middle C and A that you have not yet identified.
steps.content: Note the three keys between Middle C and A that you have not yet identified. These keys are "D," "E" and "F." Put your ring finger above the F, your middle finger above the E, your first finger above the D, and your thumb above the C.

steps.title: Play the following pattern:
steps.content: Play the following pattern: "FF EE DD C." These keys match the pitches for the words, "How I wonder what you are."

steps.title: Play the next part.
steps.content: Play the next part. Place your little finger above the G, your ring finger above the F, your middle finger above the E, and your index finger on the D key.

steps.title: Play the pitches for "Up above the world so high."
steps.content: Play the pitches for "Up above the world so high." The keys are as follows: "GG FF EE D."

steps.title: Repeat the same pitches for "Like a diamond in the sky":
steps.content: Repeat the same pitches for "Like a diamond in the sky": GG FF EE D.

steps.title: Return to the pattern (and fingering) that you played at the beginning of the song.
steps.content: Return to the pattern (and fingering) that you played at the beginning of the song. "Twinkle twinkle little star"â€”"CC GG AA G."

steps.title: Complete the song.
steps.content: Complete the song. "How I wonder what you are" FF EE DD C.

steps.title: Put the whole song together.
steps.content: Put the whole song together. If you have trouble memorizing it at first, write the letter names of the notes down on a piece of paper and place the paper above or below the keys on your keyboard. Look at the paper while you play until you've memorized the song.
